node.docblock:
@description: PanListenerView component created to making listening to swipe and drag events easier
@example: https://github.com/wix/react-native-ui-lib/blob/master/demo/src/screens/componentScreens/PanListenerScreen.tsx

description.text:
@description: PanListenerView component created to making listening to swipe and drag events easier
@example: https://github.com/wix/react-native-ui-lib/blob/master/demo/src/screens/componentScreens/PanListenerScreen.tsx

This is were you will get notified when a drag occurs
onDrag = ({directions, deltas}) => {...}
directions - array of directions
deltas - array of deltas (same length and order as directions)
Both arrays will have {x, y} - if no x or y drag has occurred this value will be undefined

This is were you will get notified when a swipe occurs
onSwipe = ({directions, velocities}) => {...}
directions - array of directions
velocities - array of velocities (same length and order as directions)
Both arrays will have {x, y} - if no x or y swipe has occurred this value will be undefined
This is were you will get notified when the pan starts

This is were you will get notified when the pan ends
The user has released all touches while this view is the responder.
This typically means a gesture has succeeded

This is were you will get notified when the pan ends
Another component has become the responder,
so this gesture should be cancelled

The directions of the allowed pan (default allows all directions)
Types: UP, DOWN, LEFT and RIGHT (using PanningProvider.Directions.###)
The sensitivity beyond which a pan is no longer considered a single click (default is 5)

The sensitivity beyond which a pan is no longer considered a drag, but a swipe (default is 1.8)
Note: a pan would have to occur (i.e. the panSensitivity has already been surpassed)

Is there a view that is clickable (has onPress etc.) in the PanListenerView.
This can affect the panability of this component.
Will be called with the current location ({left, top}) when the pan has ended
Ignore panning events while this is true
Allow the view to be animated (send animation via style; default is false)
Temporary prop required for migration to Picker's new API
Picker current value in the shape of {value: ..., label: ...}, for custom shape use 'getItemValue' prop
Callback for when picker value change
SINGLE mode or MULTI mode

Render custom picker item

Custom picker props (when using renderPicker, will apply on the button wrapper)
Add onPress callback for when pressing the picker
A function that extract the unique value out of the value prop in case value has a custom structure (e.g. {myValue, myLabel})
A function that extract the label out of the value prop in case value has a custom structure (e.g. {myValue, myLabel})
A function that returns the label to show for the selected Picker value
The picker modal top bar props
Show search input to filter picker items by label
Style object for the search input (only when passing showSearch)
Placeholder text for the search input (only when passing showSearch)
callback for picker modal search input text change (only when passing showSearch)
Render custom search input (only when passing showSearch)
Allow to use the native picker solution (different style for iOS and Android)
Callback for rendering a custom native picker inside the dialog (relevant to native picker only)
Pass props to the list component that wraps the picker options (allows to control FlatList behavior)

Enables tracking of the keyboard when it's dismissed interactively (false by default).
Why? When using an external keyboard (BT),
you still get the keyboard events and the view just hovers when you focus the input.
Also, if you're not using interactive style of dismissing the keyboard
(or if you don't have an input inside this view) it doesn't make sense to track it anyway.
(This is caused because of the usage of inputAccessory to be able to track the
keyboard interactive change and it introduces this bug)
Allow control safe area
the current selected value of the picker
callback for when a value change
pass custom style

pass custom label style: fontSize, fontFamily, color
Note: label's color will override the text color (hex only)
The height of the selected item
The color of the wheel picker (hex only)
pass custom style for the picker item
The reference to the actual text input (or the keyboard may not reset when instructed to, etc.)

description.text:
@description: View that allows replacing the default keyboard with other components
@example: https://github.com/wix/react-native-ui-lib/blob/master/demo/src/screens/nativeComponentScreens/keyboardInput/KeyboardInputViewScreen.js
Content to be rendered above the keyboard
A callback for when the height is changed

iOS only.
The reference to the actual text input (or the keyboard may not reset when instructed to, etc.).
This is required.
The keyboard ID (the componentID sent to KeyboardRegistry)
The props that will be sent to the KeyboardComponent
Callback that will be called when an item on the keyboard has been pressed.
Callback that will be called if KeyboardRegistry.requestShowKeyboard is called.
Callback that will be called once the keyboard has been closed

iOS only.
The scrolling behavior, use KeyboardAccessoryView.iosScrollBehaviors.X where X is:
NONE, SCROLL_TO_BOTTOM_INVERTED_ONLY or FIXED_OFFSET

default: FIXED_OFFSET

iOS only.
Show the keyboard on a negative scroll

default: false

iOS only.
Set to false to turn off inset management and manage it yourself

default: true

iOS only.
Set to true manageScrollView is set to true and still does not work,
it means that the ScrollView found is the wrong one and you'll have
to have the KeyboardAccessoryView and the ScrollView as siblings
and set this to true

default: false

iOS only.
Add a (white) SafeArea view beneath the KeyboardAccessoryView

default: false

iOS only.
Allow hitting sub-views that are placed beyond the view bounds

default: false

iOS only.
Whether or not to handle SafeArea
default: true
